reviewDescription: It's okay. I did return it because my phone kept falling out. My phone is way too big to be fitting in this. It's very cute and pink I've never seen that before so that's why I bought it. The sticky bottom didn't really stick to my car even with the plate that comes with it. It's okay

I got this for my wife for her B.day. Purchased it because I typed into Amazon "UTV/ATV Phone holder". This came up with a bunch of others. But got this one because it said worked great on a UTV. WELL... NO it does not!! Well it worked, but by the end of the first day of dusty driving, the automatic locking arms were no longer sliding, and then clicked like crazy when pushing in. I ended up putting on the older phone holder from RAM, and I guess she's still happy with that one. This one now... well, sitting in the closet because I wont return it because it physically doesn't work right.. but it's my fault for using it like the ad said. DO NOT BUY This for an ATV or UTV, but I'm sure it would work in a dry environment, like inside a vehicle.
Does not stick to dash as well as I would like for it to
This has been great until 6/7/24… it fell off while my car was parked in Oregon. It will now not reattach and hold…
It’s not the best took me a couple try’s to get it to stick properly
I ended up never using it after I had issues with getting it set up. My Ford Focus dash also didn't really have a good spot to attach it to.

reviewTitle: Some Aspects Great, Some Not Great
reviewDescription: I bought this as a replacement for the phone mount I had in my car for years. I really loved how it came with multiple ways to mount my phone (vent, dash, or windshield). It was easy to install. I first tried the dash mount, and it would not stick. I tried for days over and over again but it just wouldn't stick. I then moved to using the vent clip mount and it is absolutely wonderful. In regards to the part that actually holds the phone, it seems VERY sturdy (sturdier and stronger than my last one), but it doesn't automatically clamp. Because of this, it takes much longer to set up my phone than I'm used to. It's a bit of a personal annoyance as I have to use 2 hands to put up my phone until I figure out how to do it with one hand quickly, but it's not a deal breaker. The strong grip of the phone holding part is enough of a win to make it worth it.
The holder worked for good time then heat came on windshield and a sticky film was left on windshield. and would not stick anymore
Really like it but if you have any sort of a textured dashboard, the included adhesive plate nor the suction cup will work. I stuck it to my window. Two weeks later it is still good

This item was easy to install, and easy to use. Upon trying to remove it recently, I bought it maybe two months ago tops, I found that it had melted to the inside of the windshield. I suppose if you never want to remove it that’s fine, but if you do, you damage it trying to get it off because it had melted to the inside of the windshield. I suppose it’s because of the heat, but of course it will endure tremendous heat in the summertime inside of a vehicle at all times. I would sway from this if you want to remove it and still be able to use it.Update:After posting this review I was contacted by their customer service and offered a replacement. I was apprehensive for obvious reasons and did not respond right away. They contacted me again and offered me an Amazon gift card to right the wrong.  I accepted.

I got this holder and it was great at first, but I did notice it had some play even after you tighten it down. My biggest problem was that I live in a hot climate, the suction cup melted to the windshield. When I pulled it off, I was able to clean the glass off east of plastic, but the cup itself stayed sticky. I actually got a plastic bag stuck to it and pieces of it melted into the cup.
Great suction and  adhesive, but it has to be on a smooth dashboard… I loved it but it’s a shame it didn’t last
instructions not clear. sticky didn't last long. suction cup not strong enough to hold phone with case

The box was torn and parts were put back in a way that it couldn't even close. The stickers have been removed from the adhesive pads and kind of put back on. If you're going to sell me a used box item I'd like to pay used box prices.  As far as the quality goes this should be a 19.99 item. I would not trust it fully extended and/or in landscape mode. I'm using a Samsung 23 Ultra which is a big phone and this seems pretty weak
Not worth the money, cheap plastic

Bought three of these for ourselves and it held great for awhile till it reached summer! With the heat of inside the vehicle as well as the windshield heat, the glue on the suction got so hot that it meted and will not hold anymore, leaving a sticky mess!
Ended up using the vent holder instead of the dash/windshield mount. Don't really like it.

The overall flexibility fine. However, the flat plate for the suction cup mount needs stronger adhesive.  It would not stick at all. Barely tacky.  I had to remove the adhesive pad that came on it and replace it with trim adhesive. Also, if you have a case that stores credit cards it might not hold your phone securely.  The side clamps might not be deep enough.

I bought this product to put on my Mazda Miata so I can mount the phone. While the part that you can clip onto the air conditioning ducts work, the part that you would put on the dash does not work at all. It has zero ability to stick to anything. I was very disappointed in that aspect of this product. Since that was the sole reason I purchased it. I would post a picture of it sitting proudly on my Mazda Miata dash, however it would be impossible for that to happen since it doesn't stick to anything.

It will not stay attached to the dash with the so Chipco I have one and two other cars have no issues whatsoever. I’ve done all the steps to clean it Kohl’s for a short time, and then falls off no matter what I do will not work.

I purchased two, one for my work van and one for my car. The work van on would not stay stuck, even after letting the base cure for 24 hours. Outside of that, I feel it's operation is a bit rudimentary/in-elegant. It's quite bulky and if your phone is wider, it can be difficult to reach the release button.
The quality is really good and I really liked it, but had to return it as it was not deep enough to fit my large phone case.
For the price, I wish it was just easier to move the fact that you have to unscrew it to turn it landscape or portrait I would think this could be done without that.

reviewTitle: Good quality but not suitable for flip folio case
reviewDescription: This item was advertised as holding deep phones, but it's brackets are too short to hold a phone with flip-over case.

I have a pop socket, as I'm sure a lot of people have, and though this was big enough to house my phone when I take off the case or even it if was just the case alone but since I have a pop socket it's too thick for the holder. I don't want to take my phone out every time I get in and out of my car. I how to one day use it, cuz I never got around to returning it, so it just sits there for now in the box.

Concerned about the inability to stick to my not-so-smooth dashboard and/or the chance that I won't be able to clean the leather grooves after removal, I opted for the vent louvre configuration. Regardless of how much I tighten it, the mount inevitably wiggles it's way out... and it's not because I don't tighten it enough. The V-shaped clamping fingers do not provide enough uniform friction to maintain a reliable fixation under normal road vibration. So, I need to take it off and re-tighten every week or so. Otherwise, all other aspects of the mount seem good.

Overall the product is great from suction power, adhesion and was easy to install. It’s held up the only issue I have is if you have a pop socket on the back of your phone it’s bulkiness cause it to stick out and unable to secure your phone w/o adjusting it just right.01/29/21: I am editing this review because last night my phone mount lost its suction and fell off my dashboard. I had not changed my phone or case and have had the product for about a month. I am sending it back for a refund so that is why I’m changing my rating and review for this product, so disappointed.

The suction/adhesion is great.  The extendable arm allows us to put it in a great spot in the car so that we can use the mount without it obstructing anything.  The only reason I can't give it 5-stars is because it's titled "Thick Case & Big Phones Friendly" but it's not quite big enough to handle the grips on either my wife or my phone very well.  It's seems like it does, but often our phones will fall out of it which is both frustrating and distracting.UPDATE: Customer Service is great and they gave me a full refund when they saw this review

reviewTitle: Bad product, but good customer support
reviewDescription: The suction on this device is horrible. It refuses to remain attached for more than a minute at a time. However, customer support reached out to me and offered either a full replacement or a refund. I opted for the refund.
I really liked this but it didn’t stick well at all. It came off quickly. I’m going to restick it with command strips.
The main mount sticky part was defective. I've used this mount before but I'm disappointed with it this time. I'll have to use a diffrent one in the future.
This product is not worth the money it will not stick to the dashboard know matter how much you clean it.  The cradel that holds the phone will not adjust for your phone. It was a waste of money

reviewTitle: Not for big phone or case
reviewDescription: Use it for a Google map for directions on my phone  ,keep falling from my dash board on the highway I had to park at the emergency curb. Am using samsung galaxy s10 plus.
After 2 months the adhesive wore off and continuously fell from my dash. My phone ended up on the floor. The set up and functionality are great, but it just doesn’t last unfortunately. Unsatisfactory
I was so happy when I received it but it had been impossible to attach it to the car. As soon as I am driving and I turn, it gets loose. I had one before, very similar and I never had this problem🥲

I'm not able to get this to stick anywhere. maybe it's me i dont know.i ended up putting it in my cup holder and it might be my favorite spot for it.

reviewDescription: Fantastic holder except when you use the sticky window patch, it can only be used once.i wish they would've included a second window patch. After it's used once, it can't be used again. That's the downside to this phone holder.

I need to return it, but such a hassle.
Not too bad for the price, but still disappointing it only lasts a year.  Best spend a little more money on something that will last.

This would probably work for normal phones or small cases. 2 stars because it specifically advertises as working for deep phone cases, but the arms are still too shallow for my iPhone 11 with a credit card slot on the back. Bummer.

My only complaint is I have a pretty thin Otterbox iPhone case with a Pop Socket mounted to the back, and I feel like it’s barely in there sometimes. I clamp it really tight and I’ve still had my phone pop out a couple times on bumpy roads. I just wish it was a bit deeper.Other than that, I recommend just be cautious about the Pop Socket that thing.

reviewTitle: Do not get if you have a thick Phone Case

I was looking for something that would fit my phone. It's a galaxy s10e. In a regular otterbox. But I do have a hand holder thing on the back. It's simply a strap of stretchy fabric so I can hold my phone. That extra 1/4" added to my case makes this thing entirely useless...it'll hold my phone for a few moments. Then it falls out. The suction cup has also failed twice now. I'm really sad bc the design of it is great. But sadly I can't use it at all even tho it's described as being a deep phone holder. It's not.If you don't have the extras on your phone tho I'm sure it's be great.

reviewTitle: Works well enough for the price
reviewDescription: I live in Texas, needless to say temps are getting pretty high (it’s currently mid July). The suction melts off if I leave it suctioned on my dash and my phone has overheated multiple times leaving it directly in the sun.The air vent clip attachment isn’t the best fit for my car and tends to get loose. Also, it takes away a vent in a very hot month with temps still rising.Needles to say there could be vast improvements but it gets the job done. Not the worst purchase of you want a cheap solution to mounting your phone. Just some things to consider before purchasing!

reviewTitle: Adhesive doesn’t last long and can’t reach support
reviewDescription: Bought this item in November 2020 and was very happy with it until now (July 2021).  The adhesive failed and the entire thing came off the dashboard.  I had hoped to be able to order just the adhesive circle, since the rest of the item was intact and still working very well, but got an error when I clicked on “get support.”  I will have to look elsewhere for adhesive, but the rest of the item is still very functional and well made.  Just too bad that they don’t include an extra adhesive circle or two, would be extremely helpful.

My first time installing, I followed the instructions but the plastic with adhesive that sticks to the car always seems to not be strong enough to hold my SX Max. I messaged the seller & they sent me a new plastic adhesive piece very quickly & hassle free. I followed as instructed, changed the placement this time & it’s lasted longer than the first time….but it is still lifting.It will probably do well with the air vent clip (a pro of its versatility) & the sides that hold it in place are very durable.

Good suction power. Worked fine for about 6 months before it began to melt. It was fine for a while though the melting suction cup was causing it to droop and slide down the windshield. Ignored the problem for a few more months and today it was 100F when it finally gave up and fell off the windshield. Great adhesion I guess.

reviewTitle: If you're willing to use super glue, this is an ok mount.
reviewDescription: The suction cup is useless.  However, the Adhesive on the plastic plate that you stick on your car first is fine.  Pick a spot where you are comfortable with the mount sitting.  After that, the suction cup is unreliable at its best.  Since the rest of the mount is adjustable and quite sturdy, I decided that at this price point I would simply super glue the suction cup in my preferred position on top of the adhesive plate.I give it an overall rating of 3 since I can now use it regularly and it did improve functionality within my car.

reviewTitle: Held up well until it didnt
reviewDescription: This holder lasted me 2 1/2 years before it gave out. This summer was too hot and humid for it and the adhesive melted right off the windshield. But until then it worked great, no complaints. I like how easily adjustable the size is, although its a bit of a struggle to do one-handed if your other hand is on the wheel. Overall, i feel like i got enough bang for my buck.
The plastic is sturdy and it is well made & wellPackaged.

reviewTitle: I like the mount but it does not stick
reviewDescription: The suction cup does not adhere to our car. The phone mount is great size. We love the arm on it.
Good sturdy holder, hasn't lost suction yet, good price.
Have had it about a year and it work perfectly.

reviewTitle: Easy install nice looking and works good
reviewDescription: This product is nice looking soft eject of your phone from holder. Just a couple things tho. If you have anything like a finger holder on the back of your phone make sure you clamp your phone in tight  the space cuz it's not flush can cause it to drop. I wish the arm was a tad bit longer  but it's a good product and handles different size phones without issue.

reviewTitle: update 2 re: UV Film helped prevent Rubber seal (glue) fails and makes a hot mess
reviewDescription: the replacement product made it through a very hot summer and the replacement seems to be working as expected.  i think the additional UV film between the glass and the product helped, but not scientific test.previous note below:I was contacted by the vendor and have received two new replacements for this product. In addition, to the replacement the vendor sent along additional UV film to add between the windshield and rubber/vinyl (?) seal to help reduce the chances that direct sun melts/ruins the material.Thank you very much Mary for that. I appreciate your diligence in correcting this.I have not install the new product yet - and it's fall/winter now - so I won't be able to change the review until I see how the new product performs through warmer weather.Original comment below:Works great, until summer comes (East coast) and the sun melts the glue/silicone and the product fails completely leave a mess of glue on the glass.Purchased 3 of these for 3 vehicles - two out of the three have failed this way.The silicone material used to attach to glass windshield is absolute garbage.Throw your money directly into the landfill instead.

reviewTitle: UPDATE: Wonderful till summer arrived, and the adhesive melted
reviewDescription: UPDATE Nov 2022I must commend these folks for their phenomenal customer service. Based on my review, they reached out to me directly to find a way to make this right. I was not interested in a replacement and am content to use the air vent clip. They insisted on sending me an Amazon gift certificate to compensate me for my trouble -- and they would not take no for an answer.If you're not sure whether this clip will work for you, it's certainly worth a try with customer service this good. These folks raise the bar. Thank you!__________I loved this all last winter. Then summer arrived, and the adhesive just melted. The whole thing slid down the front of my dash, leaving a sticky trail of goo.  :-(I'll be logging a question to ask whether anyone has found a good way to clean this off your dash without ruining the dash.If you live in a climate that never gets above 75 degrees Fahrenheit, then this might work well for you. Otherwise, bear in mind you car gets a lot hotter than the outside temps.

reviewTitle: It does what it says on the tin.
reviewDescription: I've ordered one of these before but I forgot to remove it when I sold my car.  It works great.  It's well put together.  This product is identical to similar ones listed, just with different names.  They are no better or worse.  The vent clip is the stand out feature.  It's well put together and holds on tight.  There is zero chance this thing will fall off in transit.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because if you drive a smaller car, the sheer bulk of the arm will obscure too much windshield.  I went from a Chevy Trailblazer to a Corolla and there was no way I felt comfortable using the main holder.  Your mileage may vary.  My fault for not remembering how chonk this thing could be.

I bought this in 2023, and it worked great for about 6 months. I actually like it so much that I bought a new one last month to replace "this one," but I'm afraid to put the new one on because, as you can see, it weeps this thick sticky glue everywhere. I have cleaned it off a few times, but as you can tell, it just keeps coming. It's such a mess and almost impossible to clean.  What do you think?  Take the old one off and try again, or is the new one going to make the same unbelievably sticky impossible to clean mess?  I'm hoping "VICSEED Phone Holders for Your Car people" reach out to give me some direction, and I also humbly ask how I clean this gook off my window.  Thank you .

The #1 reason I purchased this was because it says in the information, “Includes a 3M adhesive pad which can smooth your textured dashboard”.  I cleaned my dashboard very well before I tried this and it didn’t even last a month. Added to which, the vent clip they show you in the picture is not the vent clip they send you. The one I received doesn’t fit my vents. I missed the return window by a day or I would be sending it back.

reviewTitle: Vicseed- that’s not what suction means
reviewDescription: I bought this phone car mount because it advertised using a “strong suction cup” as one of the methods for attaching the mount to your car via the windshield- I live in Florida, and having read the reviews I didn’t want to risk using the adhesive to attach the mount because apparently heat causes it to melt and make a mess. I receive my package, only to find that the “strong suction cup” advertised by this company is not a suction cup at all, rather a silicone pad with adhesive attached.Vicseed, for your reference, here is the definition of “suction”: the production of a partial vacuum by the removal of air to procure adhesion. Suction cups don’t require adhesive, rather the suction is created by voiding a vacuum of air. As I can’t risk using the adhesive in South Florida, I am forced to use the vent clip, which I did not want to do as my large phone blocks the flow of AC. Very unhappy that this device did not perform as advertised, or even come with the advertised parts.Another note, if your phone has a PopSocket or something similar you will have to remove your case so your phone will be secure in the holder. Another disappointment, as this device was also advertised to accommodate all sizes and thicknesses of phone cases.

I bought this for my wife as we were going to be going on a pretty long road trip. I read a lot of the reviews and figured I would give it a shot. Much like everyone else I have been searching for a good car mount for a long time and have spent hundreds of doallrs on devices like this.This first issue is the puck that comes with the mount that you use to mount to the dashboard  had less glue than a piece of scotch tape. I stuck it to the dashboard and it slid off. I heated the sticky side and put it back on the dashboard. It stayed put for a while but eventually fell off while we were driving nearly causing an accident.W eventually got it to stick to the window, my guess is that it has more to do with the glue on the suction cup than anything, but it got us through the trip. The lijsting indicated the mount is  "[Thick Case & Big Phones Friendly]" which we did not find to be true at all. In fact, my wife has to remove her phone from her case to get it to fit as she has a pop socket the this mount will not accommodate.For now this Junker will go in the box with the rest of the useless plastic mounts of failures and disappointments.
I could not get it to stay on any part of my car, even the perfectly smooth pieces. The vent one would not stay in either.
The knob to position the phone broke (see picture for the crack) so the phone faces down and can’t be seen when I drive.  Just be careful when you tighten it.
Se daño con muy poco uso
It was really big in my vehicle.  I returned.

Got this holder for a christmas present.  It didn't work for me in my Chevy Silverado as there was no dash area that was flat enough to allow the mounting disc to effectively adhere.  I reached out to Vicseed's customer service, and they were amazing.  Helen and May reviewed their products and replaced this holder free of charge with a new magnetic holder that works great.  I was super impressed with their prompt service and resolution!
Removed from windshield to move over and it would no longer stick. Only used it 1 month..

I bought this not realizing there was an adhesion component and I was disappointed to find that out when the product arrived. I looked for options that didn’t have that. I was fine using the air vent clip version until it broke today.
The suction cup doesn’t hold for more then 20 minutes ever. The clip that goes into the vent is cheep and the ball and socket part doesn’t hold the device where you want it, it keeps falling down.
It won't stick on my dashboard. Putting it in the vent it doesn't get tight enough to stay.  When I put my phone on it at times it falls on the floor.  It cracked my new phone hitting my stick shift.

It did not fit my needs.  My phone would not fit in the holder and when it did, the suction power was compromised.  I was not able to adjust it to have the phone facing me.  It might work for other phones, but it did not work for my iPhone 11 Pro Max. Two stars!

reviewTitle: Aw, I had bad luck with my extension, but they seem to work for everyone else.

Did not stick to dash no matter what I did. The clip is good in the air-conditioner vent.

I like this phone mount, BUT i had a few troubles with it. The adhesive circle didn’t not stay attach, so the mount fell off the dashboard. The rotating knob that extends or shortens never worked.I have to push it back all the time to keep it in place.

reviewTitle: Won't stay up. Ridiculous waste of money.

reviewTitle: Almost passed the test of time
reviewDescription: Suction stickiness failed just after return period. Completely useless now... 😒

I’m sure it’s designed to improve adhesion, but it doesn’t hold as well as others I have used without it. Every morning, it must be re-attached to the mounting disk. reviewTitle: Well.  The quality of the item is good.  But the dashboard doesn’t work at all. AT ALL.

reviewTitle: can not use in multipal cars
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking i could switch this device between my 3 cars by appling suction cup to windshield BUT according to the directions once it it is sucked in place and try to unstick it it wont stick again.I tried to use the one from my wife's car and ruined it when the suction cup rolled up into a ball while i took it off the disk on the dashboard

reviewTitle: Suction cup does not stay on window.
reviewDescription: Did not meet my needs.  Disappointed.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t stick anywhere and doesn’t fit to clip on the vent.
reviewDescription: It holds a phone well. Not that such a thing is useful if it won’t stick anywhere in the car without falling off and doesn’t fit correctly in the vents. It’s like it expects the little plastic parts of the vent to be narrower so it won’t go far enough into mine to actually latch on. Basically the car is an older model I bought for my au pairs, so I am just going to superglue it to the dashboard now.

I tried using in my vents and i could not get it to go into vent and it would not hold my my Samsung note 10.So itried the the other option  the stickon base with the suckion cup and it keep comming off my dash. I finally use super glue to the base andsuckin cup and it is now working for me. I willprobably never be able to get it off my dash now.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t stay longer than a week.
reviewDescription: This product does not have good suction at all. It will not stay out for longer than a week. It just falls off. The vent holder works better.

The suction does not work at all. If you live anywhere were the car gets too warm or too cold it will come unstuck constantly.  Which is so unsafe when driving. I had to superglue it down so it would stay.

reviewTitle: Loved it while it lasted! 6 days before the adhesive failed.
reviewDescription: I really loved this for the 6 days I was able to use it! I wish the adhesive was stronger though! The flat section of my dash was cleaned thoroughly with 91% rubbing alcohol prior to application, to no avail.

This things sticks to your window by the suction cup but the thing is the suction cup doesn't actually suction to anything it just has a sticky adhesion substance on it, and when you flip the suction cup lever to tighten the mount down locks with such ease and it doesn't feel sturdy.

reviewTitle: After a few weeks the suction does not stick at all it falls off so easily
reviewDescription: Look how easy it falls off with such minor effort. I've even tried washing the cup as the instructions asked but still doesn't work well.

3m tape is not sticky and after cleaning an area on my dash 3 times with 91% alcohol the suction cup pad will not stick to my dash. The suction cup part is sticky as hell and when put on the mounting plate, I almost couldn’t get the suction cup off because the silicone is so sticky/gooey.

Will not hold my iPhone XR with a thick case. I put it in there and it stays for a few minutes then falls out in the floor (I can’t answer calls when it’s on the floor). Good idea and I guess it will work with a phone with a thin or no case.

reviewTitle: Just get an air vent setup
reviewDescription: The suction cup is more asherant than the pad that they want you to put it on, and that pad cant even stick to my hand under its own weight, other than the reason you might be interested in getting this, the included air vent clip is all that is keeping this from the trash can, also the phone holder itself is pretty good as well.
Tried many times to stick to my dashboard and no luck. Adhesive it not sturdy suction did mot work. I just use the piece I can connect to my vent
Worked great for 6 weeks. One arm broke off, and now it's useless.

The round piece that goes on the car permanently did not get stuck and fell off only a day later.. I tried to get in contact with them but Amazon sends me to a weird website. I would just like a replacement for that part, maybe it came defective ? I don’t know.
Can't hold up to the Texas sun. Lasted about a year and a half. Probably would work great in a little cooler environments.

Adjustable clip to attach to air vent does not stay tight.  Needed this adapter for rental car. Tightened the clip repeatedly still came loose. Phone and clip continually fell off causing my phone to fall off. But a dependable design
Received my dash cam yesterday & it's great so far. I called customer service today & it was a pleasant experience.  I'll see in several days if I get what I asked for.

I purchased one of the Vicseed Phone Holder and the clip of the phone holder got broken.I was able to receive the Clip back with thePhone holder after I contacted Customer service in just two days. The clip is also really sturdy and it attaches well to the Air vent.

This product readily adhered to a flat, smooth plastic surface next to my radio.  I’ve had no issues in either hot or cold with it losing adhesion.Only gripes:  1) that the clamp does not hold my iPhone 13 ProMax in OtterBox very securely (at near max the clamp will hold and almost too thick). 2) the button to release the mount when it’s tight on the phone is a) flimsy and b) poorly located (have to reach behind phone to release).Would by again.

Originally gave this one star because it didn't work on the dash board like I wanted it to but they contacted me and tried to work with me even send me a new one for my car it also didn't work on the dash but for the window is great they really care about customer satisfaction
Use to hold cell in view for use while getting driving directions

Worked absolutely great for almost an entire year. Bought in August 2021, today the bottom adhesive just let go of my dashboard and even though I pushed it back down and reattached it wouldn’t stay. To be be fair to it though the Texas heat is crazy and this about the length of time I expected to last.

It can be kind of a pain getting my phone in and out. My friends often pull the entire AC attached/mount off when I have them put it in. It is reasonably sturdy put has fallen off a couple of times. Overall, this is a pretty good product.I do have an iPhone 12 Pro Max, so does fit this phone.

You'd think Id know that plastic is fragile by now, but apparently the last brain cell left with the rest of them. It works great in my Hyundai Veloster, just make sure you dont tighten it too tight, it WILL break the plastic. :)

reviewTitle: Sturdy holder, vent clip is best option
reviewDescription: Bought this as a gift.  It's easy to install and once done, holds the phone very well.  Even on road bumps, the phone does not move.  However, the black pad and its adhesive underneath does not stick, even after the 24hr wait.  The pad comes right off--it doesn't even feel sticky.  Because of this, you're defaulted to use the vent clip.  Great vent clip, bad adhesive pad for arm mount.

Looks great, seems very durable, great price for what appeared to be really good quality.My problem was I had a pop socket mounted on the back of my iPhone 12 Pro Max case which would not allow the phone to fit securely in the clamp. Was not willing to get rid of my pop socket because that’s my favorite accessory, so I returned the holder.
The adhesive material melted and the whole device fell off after one year and will no longer stick in place

The small disc's adhesive side (where you mount the main arm to hold your phone) doesn't stick to any surface. I followed the instructions: clean the area, press firmly and leave for 24hrs. But the disc merely slipped off, I figured the adhesive wasnt sticky enough. To make matters worse, its not like the suction cup can stick to any surface, it has to stick to that small disc or else you cant use the arm mount. Figured you can just place more adhesive to the belly of that small disc plate but I was hoping the arm would work and if im purchasing a product I would expect ALL of it to work not just 50% of it.However, the small vent clip works perfectly so the product isn't completely a bust? But it doesnt excuse the fact that I made this purchase mostly for the arm not the vent clip. If you were looking to use the arm like I was then it's best you find another product.
During driving,phone mount shakes.

This is the second brand of phone holder I ordered with the adhesive and both fell off in the cold. I will not use the vent feature because I don't want my phone to overheat in the winter. In my case it was a waste of money.

Edit: does not hold my new phone Samsung Galaxy s20, the best part about this phone holder is that it melts noticed the rubber dripping down my windshield. When I went to go pull it off I had to use a knife because it melted to my windshield.If you live in a climate where it gets above 90°, don't buy this.Holds the phone very well. We went on a road trip and at times this thing bounces quite a bit and the phone never came out and the suction never failed. Amazing to have for a road trip, I've probably owned 4 different holders and I'd say this is my favorite. Also the button to release the holder has a very well thought out placement. You can just grab and click in one motion.
My cel is very light, the cel holder kept falling down, I put it on my window a few times and then dashboard just to see and it would not stay in place at all,

reviewTitle: Does Not Hold Suction or the weight of the phone (iPhone 11)
reviewDescription: This item did not hold my phone. I attempted to attach it to the dashboard, the windshield, and even the side window. I also used the 3M tape to help. That didn’t work so I added additional store bought 3M tape. Still would hold my phone.  I ended up purchasing some heavy duty mounting tape that I saw on an infomercial (but bought the generic version on Amazon because it actually had better reviews).  I just attached it last night, so it hasn’t been out in the AZ heat yet, nor has it had to actually hold my phone....so we shall see. Very disappointed that the item alone did not do what it said it would and I had to spend additional money to attempt to get it to actually work. Next step may have to be actually MOUNTING it to the dashboard with screws. Ugh!

reviewTitle: Would not maintain hold on dash overnight
reviewDescription: Did not hold suction to dash. 2016 Acura
Mine does not stick on the dashboard
Unable to activate product warranty. I wanted to activate because previous vicseed phone holder broke. Disappointed with vicseed customer service.

reviewTitle: The best results! Clear way to generate equitable services
reviewDescription: The best results clearly open equal opportunities to improve the global markets correspondence with proper satisfaction and support . Thanks!!!

I wish I could give this 5 stars, but I can’t.  The arm won’t stick to the dish provided for the dash. I put the disk on the dash overnight and it won’t stick.  The weight of the arm and phone pull it off.  I put the arm on the window, and it slid down the window until the arm is resting on the dash.  I only kept it because I had a hard time finding a holder for thick phones.  I have a case on my phone and I don’t want to remove it every time I drive.  It is very sturdy and it’s very easy to get my phone on and off the holder.  I like the way the arm extends and retracts.

This item worked great at first. Easy to use, lots of options. Phone didn't fall out or slip. Very happy with it but when I moved the mount to a second car with a different more textured dash the mount doesn't stick.
It is here as well to the dash and I would highly recommend it as well be a good value

It's not exactly stylish or fancy. It simply gets the job done. If you have an extra large phone with a case like the Samsung S23+, the jaws of the holder barely can accommodate the case on the phone. But, it does fit!
Product was great but terrible for them hot days used the dashboard pad for 12 days and heat made the pad become loose and now I gotta use the vent mount

This product is easy to install and use.  I like that it has at least three different points of adjustment.  I've only been using it for a few days, so I can't speak as to the longevity of the suction sup, or the button that you push to release the sides of the holder, but so far it's holding firm.  My only wish was that it angled down more.  The section of dashboard that I had available is angled upward slightly, and it would be nice if the arm came down more so that it wouldn't be sitting so high in front of the windshield.  I haven't yet noticed any issues with it interfering with visibility, but it's something I'd take into consideration in the future.
I bought two for two cars. Unfortunately one is broken. Then I bought another one. Seems ok now.

I rec'd the product yesterday and was all excited about mounting it to the dashboard of my car.  When I got home, I parked my car in the driveway and proceeded to read the directions and attach it to my dashboard.  Either my phone is too heavy or the equipment is cheaply made.  While the main part of the apparatus did attach, once I inserted my phone into the part that holds the cell phone, the entire thing came undone and would not re-attach to my dash. On the flip side of that, there is another way to attach your phone.  The piece that attaches to your a/c vent seems to be the best option for me.  So I'm using that for now.  But I'd like to use the larger piece that attaches to the dashboard.  I'm going to give it another try this weekend, hoping for better results.

reviewTitle: Doesn't work if you're phone/case (Wallet) w/ Popsocket measures greater than 0.5"
reviewDescription: Sadly my phone is 0.8" according to my caliper. I have the S21 ultra with a phone case (VRS design) that has a built in wallet and attached on the back is the Pop Socket (gen 2) making it just a bit too thick for the arms to make contact.  The design does seem robust but falls short of those of us with thick phones. Also a little disappointing was that compared to the other phone holders that has a switch on the base to retract the arms so it auto closes when placing the phone on the holder.  That aside overall good build quality but sadly will have to return this and see if there are other options for me.

I tried the vent clamp and the vent louver is too long for he clamp to  get a hold.  I tried the suction and my dash (Subaru) was too porous and the suction would not hold.  I tried the dash pad and there wasn't a strong enough adhesion to hold the device in place.  It kept falling off.  Maybe it will work for you but it didn't work for me.

The adhesive on the suction cup is great. Has never fallen off my windshield since I installed it 8 months ago. The arms hold phones great, even my Galaxy S21+ with a pretty thick case AND popsocket on the back. My problem is that the suction cup WAS clear. The sun exposure over time has turned the suction cup and awful, ugly yellow. With it being suggested to be used on windshields, the suction cup should be black.

This product is great, except for one thing… the adhesive fails when it gets warm, so if you park your car in the sun, be prepared to come back and find your cell phone holder on the floor instead of adhered to your dash.

reviewTitle: Purchased for the dash mount, used vent mount
reviewDescription: The adhesive on the dash mount was aweful and didn't stick to my girl's dashboard at all. Even with thurough cleaning, just slid right off.However, the vent mount is the most secure one I've ever used and fit my note 20 ultra with a thick poetic case beautifully!5 stars for the vent mount and phone mounts. 0 stars for the dash mount setup.
The suction cup melted and hardened to the point it was not useable. Difficult to clean the windshield where it was mounted

reviewTitle: Nice, but not for thick cases
reviewDescription: Very nice phone holder, but it is definitely not for thick cases. I have an iPhone 12 Pro Max with a Case-Mate case and a thin holder on the back and it doesn’t even come close to holding! If I had my bling case with diamonds or my thick Otterbox it would be even worse! Don’t waste your money on this nice holder if you have a thick case because it’s only for a thin phone!

reviewTitle: Won’t fit with pop socket or loopy
reviewDescription: The suction and sticky stuff on the suction cup work really really well. It never fell off my dash even in the southern heat. The problem I have though, is it says it for “bulky” cases. It wouldn’t fit my iPhone 11 with a loopy case on it, and it won’t fit with the slim case and a pop socket on it. If it was really created for bulky cases, then it should fit just fine with the pop socket.

Bed that holds phone need to be deeper and adjustable, clips that hold phone should be longer, my iPhone has a charger attached to my phone, hold but could be better, can’t take a picture on the charger or my phone
While the adhesive works well in normal temperatures, it melts easily in high temperature environments, and it made a huge mess in my car.

reviewTitle: Struggles to hold my phone upright but good design.
reviewDescription: I'm going to be contacting the seller. The design is great but the arm isn't strong enough to hold my phone up. I tried it with my daughter's smaller phone and it did the same thing. I already have the base stuck to my dashboard so I hope I'll be able to remedy this situation.The seller sent me an email already so I'm thankful they will be easy to communicate with.I will update this review after my situation is resolved.

If I had written the review about 2 months ago I would have given it 5 stars but after a few months of use I can't keep it secured. I originally had it secured to the dash. I pulled it off one time and tried to secure it again...no dice. So I used the disc that came with it and for about and hour of my drive....looked great.  But then I got the ttiiimmmbbbeeerrr and it fell on the floor. Could not get it secured again for a long period of time.Update - After customer support notified me on how to fix, clean the suction cup, my issue the product is working very well. However, I left one star open because the heat did not have a chance to affect it. We will see next summer
I like it just don’t stay stuck that great
I got this as a I move from vehicle to vehicle a lot (not going to buy 10 of these). The suction on this is great and sometimes hard to remove. Holds well when driving on rough roads.
Excelente producto

reviewTitle: Works Good + Lot of Features and Adjustability For The Price
reviewDescription: Quality and adjustability are great, especially for the price.  Only issue has been the suction cup doesn't stick all that great to my dash.  I've cleaned, and cleaned the dash surface and the bottom side of the cup and about 2-3 times a week I'll come out to the car and it'll be lying on my floorboard where it became unstuck overnight and fell into the footwells of my car.  It's also getting more and more frequent as the spring and now summerish temperatures have come.  It still is a minor inconvenience all things considering.  Overall I am happy with it and would buy it again and again.

Overall this is exactly what you need. I bought it for my wife to use and she is very happy with it. The adjustability is great and the different ways to move it around makes for a good versatile item. My only issue is that the sticky suction cup does leave a residue once you move it. Not a big issue if you plan to leave it in the same place. Overall very happy with the whole thing

reviewTitle: May be too good at its job
reviewDescription: This thing is amazingly good at sticking and holding the phone steady, even on bumpy roads.  The only issue I have had with it is that it is too good at sticking to its surface.  The adhesive on the suction cup is so powerful that when I set it down in a place on my dashboard to see if it would work fine there, my tiny weak arms had trouble removing it to move it to a different place.  Ultimately I had to go get a screwdriver to wedge under the suction cup to leverage it enough to detach it from my dashboard.  Fantastic product, but make sure you know exactly where you want it before you remove the protective plastic from the bottom.
It was good

I purchased this product for my 2017 Toyota tundra. I followed the instructions as how to prepare the surface. However, the suction cup did not adhere to the disc  which came with it for more than a few hours before my cell phone, to include the car mount, fell unto my gear shift while driving.  So I ended up placing it on the bottom portion of my windshield. And the suction worked great!!! Overall I’m pleased with my purchase.

reviewTitle: Best car phone holder found...highly recommend
reviewDescription: By far, this is the best car phone holder I ever found after trying almost everything in the market. The extension feature and flexibility to reposition it is awesome! The suction and adhesiveness was not strong to hold a heavy phone on the dash board or windshield alone. I had to use suction on windshield and position the extended arm over the dashboard (se pic) to hold it safely without dropping from windshield. The front brackets could be redesigned to make it deeper and perhaps adjustable as well, with option to better grab and secure thick and heavy phones that use extra power battery (like mophie). The price is fair for the quality of the product. It is the most sturdy and reliable car phone holder to have, specially when driving over bumpy road. Highly recommended!

reviewTitle: Adhesive won’t stay stuck to the pad
reviewDescription: Had high hopes for this phone holder but was disappointed. Phone is to heavy for the holder to stay upright in the ac vent. Tried to use the mount on the dash, after adhering the pad to the dash (24-48 hrs) the sticky pad that attaches to the mount that holds the phone won’t stay stuck. Useless

Despite the description saying this holder can hold large and chunky phone cases, this holder couldn’t grip my iPhone, in a hard case, with a small silicone card holder on the back. My phone isn’t unreasonably thick, really. I actually bought two of the higher end holders on here until I found one -  for less than $10 - that actually could grip around my phone. Very disappointing how limited phone thickness can be with most holders on the market.

Lasted about a week it got sunny a couple days ago and the suction stopped working and it fell off my dashboard (I also had to buy extra sticky pads in order to not use the suction directly on my dashboard since I saw reviews saying it pulled off parts of the dashboard and the thing it came with didnt  work ) anyways I tried to put it back on after it had cooled down but it keeps falling off and landing in my cup holder lmao waste of money

I just went back to work last week for three days and I'm on day two this week and the spring no longer holds the phone in the mount.  I'm incredibly disappointed and wish I had an option to contact the seller and get a replacement as I'm hoping it's a fluke.  Shouldn't stop working after 5 days. Very frustrating.

Dont waste your time and definitely dont wast your money. If you like it as decoration then fine, but once you stick a phone in this thing it will jist fall off no matter what you do. The company knows this obviously, because they send you an email after you buy it saying if it doesnt qtick they'll send you a new one, but they jist make you try differnt methods that still dont work then jist ignore you. Unfortunately the width and the grip was also problematic. I would not recommend this product mainly because the adhesive doesn't work.

reviewTitle: Product broke within 1 month of use- not able to contact product support
reviewDescription: This didn’t last for a month. I am just 2 days away from the amazon return window and it breaks. The holder doesnt work anymore. I feel like i wasted my money on this. I don’t know how to contact the support since, it doesn’t let me email them.I would very much want a replacement sent to me or refund the amount i paid.Edit: The contact us form wouldn’t let me contact the support folks.

Can somebody help me please? Otherwise I will be returning this!
Do not stay on. Kept coming off the console. Poor quality
Don't  stay up it  falls  down give 1 star I don't  like it at all

reviewDescription: I found out too late to return the product that the phone on the dashboard overheats in the sun while driving. reviewTitle: Did not stay glued to the dashboard
reviewDescription: Followed directions. Cleaned dash with alcohol. Placed the black disk to the dash, waited 24 hours I then placed the suction part to the Black disk. Waited till the next day to put the phone in, and the disk came apart from the dashboard. I wish I could give it 0 stars.
Deceived by the good reviews. It didn’t stick at all, even after meticulously following directions. Can’t even return it so now it’s only future is in a landfill.

The stick part didnt work long i needed it but it was made great
Product looks good, however it will not fit my phone.

reviewTitle: Didn't Stick On Cleaned Surfaces At All
reviewDescription: This didn't work for me at all.  I followed instructions and cleaned/dried my dashboard.  The adhesion would work for about 5 minutes before falling to the floor of my car.  It was a distraction at best.  I had to stop the car and find my phone - which was still in the grips of the display.  I don't recommend this.

The following day I went out to attach the mount and before I could seal the suction cup, the base detached from the dash with almost o effort. I tried to stick it again, and it still didn't adhere. Returned it after that.
I couldn't fit the phone with the case. Wasn't for me. Returned it.
I thought it was great until I decided to use it with my phone which has a thick phone case. The product claims it's for big phones but it was still too small for mine so it's useless for me.

I loved that the vent connector was easy to place and the holder itself was soft and held my phone tightly however; the dashboard mount did not stick at all.  I had received a replacement of this product and it did not stick neither. If it would have had better adhesive it would've been the perfect mount.

reviewTitle: Suction cup does not hold to all dash materials
reviewDescription: The vent clip feature and holder for the phone are great, and is what I use. However, I bought the product for the suction cup mount. The suction cup adhesive is very weak and does not hold to the dash. My dash is an Audi and is fairly smooth.

If you must know, I have a wallet case for my iPhone. So that’s possibly why it won’t fit cause of my cards. I’m not complaining tho cause like I said, it does it’s job

I had a really hard time keeping it attched. It kept coming off the dashboard. Somehow it managed to stay on when I attached on dashboard corner next to steering wheel. So now its been working great.

Awesome phone holder, the only thing I don’t like is HOW adhesive it is. Other people might enjoy this but I almost ripped a panel off of my car trying to move the holder over haha. It is now a fixture of the car and will remain there forever.

reviewTitle: Fabulous mount until the hottest day in FL
reviewDescription: Funny how this mount stayed stuck to the window everyday until the day after it was returnable. Yesterday was the last day this mount could be replaced. Crazy coincidence. It worked flawlessly until today. In florida with all of the humidity and heat, it just could not make it another day. Total letdown on this product.

After just 2 days in my dashboard it goes off like a limp plant, put it back again press it and let it stand for minutes in a cool surrounding under our big oak tree. Try it again, nope, still won't stick. The only good thing is i can put it in my car vent. But the suction? i don't think so based on my experience.

Worked really really well….until it melted. I will say it’s been a hot month but still. I would not put this on your dashboard. I can easily get this off of glass but I think it would have ruined a plastic dash.
If fell, the sticky pad didn't stick! If it wasn't for the vent clip I would have returned it! I wanted it on my dashboard!  I settled...

I've never written a review before, but this one's a  public service. Device comes with a vent mount and an adhesion/suction. Tried out the vent mount first and it promptly broke the slat of my vent. Figured I'd give the suction a chance. Applied the adhesion, waited 24hours and used the suction on it. The adhesion immediately broke and fell off my dash. Oh well. I'd advise you to look at a  different product.

reviewTitle: Broke after less than a month's time...
reviewDescription: Plastic nut that is suppose to secure the holder in place broke yesterday. I can't navigate their website. It is in another language and has the 404 error code. Then it just opens up a new home page. Disappointed it broke already especially since I've been using it every work day. I really want to like this product, but I'm pretty bummed it broke so quickly when I've only used it for about 2 weeks.

I was so excited for this mount. I needed it to create content. I cleaned the dash and attached the metal pad (because the dash isn’t completely smooth). I waited 24 hours and as soon as I attached the suction cup to the pad it came completely off the dash. It didn’t even have the phone in it yet. Super bummed 😕

The design and concept are spot on however the suction cup left alot to be desired....i could not get it to stick and stay on anything including the windshield...it would stay for a bit and just fall off...i even cleand it as the instuctions said but not luck...would not stick to anything...so i modified it to sit in my truck the way i was wanting it too ...just without the suction cup

What a waste, the phone Mount won’t stick to the circle dashboard Mount. It sticks for about 30 min then begins to detach. The one time I didn’t catch it the sticky part landed on the floor of the car and got gravel pieces all over it now it doesn’t stick at all. I used this product a whole 2 hours before buying a better phone Mount.

reviewTitle: Not for otter cases and phone
reviewDescription: I have a note 10, plus other case plus card holder for my id attached to my case, my set up is too thick for the arms to hold, just a 1/4" wider it would be fine, why limit the thickened holder so much? The product says for thick phones well I have a Samsung s21 and it would fit that normally but I have it in a otter box and I thought hey thick is going to hold it while in the case nope there is no way this is meant for "thick" anything as my phone bearly fits out of its case

reviewTitle: Loved it but broke after a month of use
reviewDescription: I loved this product, it was super simple to install and I used it every day! But after a few months of use it won’t stay tight and when I put my phone on the holder it flops down and faces the floor. I’ve checked everything! I didn’t install it wrong, it’s broken!

Followed all the directions and it just would not stay suctioned to the dash. I mean if your phone is ultra light it would work but my phone is heavy so it just won’t stay adhered to the dash. I’m unhappy with this purchase and asked for a refund

reviewTitle: Fell off my dashboard after two days of use.
reviewDescription: The clip works fine but the adhesive that is used is not good at all. Came off my car’s dashboard with a few days of use After installation. I would use the suction instead but the manufacturer of this product thought it was a bright idea to put sticky adhesive on the suction portion of the stand. All together save your money from this one.

Also the clip is not big enough to hold my iPhone with its case on. Sadly sadly disappointed bc I really wanted this one to work

I bought this because it said it was "big phone friendly". It is anything but! Neither the dash mount nor the vent clip will hold my phone. And my phone isn't THAT big or heavy. The phone fits, but the dash mount falls off as does the vent clip.For personal reasons, I couldn't try to install it until today. I have missed the return window. That's $25 down the tubes.This thing is junk. Don't buy it.

This phone mount works great while it lasts. I’ve bought two now figured the first was a fluke. They break in the same spot every time. The weight of the phone breaks the mount everytime. I will be looking for another mount. Each one lasted maybe 4 months this one maybe 2 months.

Not a very good quality product one of the adjustment plastic nuts just crumbled this piece of the product was not abused or overtightened realizing that it seem to be not very strong also could be partly because of the hot weather would not recommend this product

reviewTitle: Do not waste your money like I did
reviewDescription: This item was useless 😕 it does no contain any stability and it does not hold the phone up, my phone it's super lightweight and it doesn't stay.

do not buy. as soon as i opened the box i didn't like it. it was way bigger than it looks, almost as big as my cellphone. on top of that, the plastic thing that's suppose to tight the screw so the lever stays in place came broken. it turns and turns and turns and never looks. than you for making waste my time and my money

Went to take this mount off of my windsheild since i got one that attaches to the vent with the mag safe thing on the phone... this mount WILL NOT come off, it has created a spider web on my windshield and the windsheild needs to be replaced now.

So the mount is supposed to be able to hold thick phone cases. It claims to hold thick battery cases..........I have a 10000mah newdery battery case on my phone and the car mount doesn't even begin to hold the phone and case in place at all. I will probably be returning it for a refund

reviewTitle: cell phone head is poorly designed
reviewDescription: The head that holds the phone is designed so it turns the phone off when you put it in the holder. The cell phone has to be manually held in position as the clamps are squeezed by hand to close the clamps around the phone. The head is rendered worthless because of the way the clamps have to be squeezed by hand to hold the phone.

The suction cup is great . I cleaned my dashboard, waited for it to dry applied the adhesive pad waited 24 hours like the instructions say and then placed the suction cup on the pad and in less than 10 minutes it fell off and wouldn’t stick again. The lever on the air vent works great but that’s not where I wanted my phone . It sits too low I needed it in the dashboard. So yeah a waste of $25 bucks

reviewTitle: Cannot get it to stay attached to windshield or dash
reviewDescription: This phone holder looks great but no matter what I do, I cannot get it to stay attached to the windshield or dash using the suction mechanism. As soon as a little vibration happens it falls off. No other option exists. Maybe the one I got has the suction mechanism faulty. I will change my review if manufacturer can get it to work for me. Otherwise I am returning it. It's currently a dead weight.

The suction was totally useless I put it on my dash would never stay suctioned. Useless for dash use. I don’t know about the other option. Only wanted it for dash. Could not remove the adhesive piece off the dash it is still there. also missed the refund date I didn’t even have time to try to fix the problem.

1. You need to have a smooth surface to utilize the suction cup. They do provide you with a plate with a foam double sided tape for this reason. I am not doing that, just personal preference.2. Suction cup has to be on a level surface.I could have avoided much of this if the description properly written out.

Followed the video instructions, and the sticky pad that suppose to stick to your dash fell off before even putting my car in drive, i touched it and wasn't even sticky...Welp its not the end of the world right because i can just stick on my windshield. Nah just fell off before getting onto the highway.  Once again ripped off by dollar general store quality products sold on amazon but thats nothing new.
Waste of money the phone cradle didn’t adhere.

reviewTitle: This was the worst purchase ever
reviewDescription: The suction would not hold no matter what I would do. I did everything the instructions said. Would. Not. Hold. I ended up throwing it out of my window this is a disgrace of a product. Do not buy this BS.

reviewTitle: This car cell phone holder has three different adjustments, looks good, has Good visibility.
reviewDescription: This is a nice phone holder. It can hold any type of cell phone you might have as the adjustments on it have a wide range. Has good gripping capability so that your phone will not fall off during any type of driving. It can also be dismantled from the holder so that you can insert it into your fresh air vents also. One drawback I found however, is that the holding apparatus on this unit will not accommodate a phone which has a protective case. The grippers are not large enough, so if you use it on top of the dash, you will have to take your protective case off the phone.

There was little wrong with the product itself, though I'm unable to remove it from my car now, it's so firmly attached.  However, if your considering this product think about your placement.  Will your phone be in the sun, will the phone have ac blown directly onto it?  My phone would heat up on the dash, and turn itself off after an hour or 2, and it was a brand new phone at the time I bought this.  Fine product in terms of quality, but does it even accomplish what you want it too.

Hi, I like this product but when I first bought it, the mount came off so I was in utter shock. Nora from the company agreed to ship me the replacement ASAP which tells alot about her character. She was apologetic and responded right away to ship me the replacement. I am very happy for that and her customer service skills are impeccable! She will go the extra yard to ensure that we (the customer) is satisfied with the service and product. I will go back to her and buy the same or another product if need be.

I had to use the connector for the a/c vent and it works good.  Was not able to use the suction cup or the adhestive.  I didn't want it on the windshield.  There was not enough room on the plastic on the dash for the adhesive.  2023 ram longhorn.

*Tested on an LG V60 with Dual-Screen Case*For heavy phones like mine, this one holds up great! Not once did my phone or the arm of the mount fall, a problem that I had with my other car mount. Installation to my windshield was pretty intuitive, and I have to say, I like the look of it as an addition to my car. It fits well and makes management of my phone easier while driving. The only slight gripe I have with it is the fact that the part that holds the phone itself (the fingers I guess?) curve inward too much and don't fit my case completely. This may be due to the extra thickness of my phone's dual-screen case and is probably an issue unique to those with extra thick cases. I would've probably preferred not having the extra curvature. However, it still holds my phone just fine, but isn't quite a 100% satisfying fit (r/mildlyinfuriating). Would still definitely recommend this for everyone who is looking for a phone mount that supports larger phones.
After moving it to a new spot a few times, it gradually falls over while you're driving. Lasted 4 months.

I wrote an earlier review for this product that was not so happy with the mount. Since then I have had great customer service from VICSEED. Because the mount would not work with my vehicle, VICSEED asked me to just keep the mount, and the company refunded my money in full. Furthermore, they wanted to figure out if another mount would work instead of the one I bought. Should you buy this product, you will not go wrong with the excellent customer service you may need.
My last one was an iOttie and it would automatically grip the phone. Now I have to use both hands to secure the phone in the holder.Mount is very secure. Release is easy.
My Car mount stropped sticking after 5 !/2 months. I contacted cs and within hours they shipped a new one.
Not bad. I did not return, but if u can find a better one, get that one. There can be better options🙃

I waited to review to see how this held up. IT STILL HOLDS UP! It's been over a year and the suction power is just great. We've had heat waves and freezing temperatures and it has a set lost its adhesion.The only con is I always have a popsocket on my case, and because it takes up a lil room in the back, sometimes it takes some finessing to get it just right so the sides will clamp just right. Otherwise my phone falls off.

I’ve had it in both cars for 6 months now. We swapped the one my wife had because this one was much nicer. I used mine horizontally, she keeps hers vertical. If you leave it open without a phone it may squeak some. But just put the grips back in and it stays quiet. Only downside was I moved it a little on the pad when I turned it horizontal so it lined up better and it loses some sticky. But 6 months and holding, so I’m still very happy.

I only returned this because I wanted a charger and ordered by mistake.  Very sturdy and good customer service.  Not happy with having to pay to return it though.  If you get a printed label it costs 7.50!!!

The one that attaches to the vent work great, it easy to install. I just site my phone there and it stays, I rearly clamp it in. The one on top I haven't used yet, but I will update it if it doesn't perform. A tip for people where I stick mine Is a flat surface  near the screen. The top of the dash might not be a flat surface.

reviewTitle: Nice holder and great support on products
reviewDescription: This is a very sturdy phone holder. I have a Samsung S20 Ultra phone with a removable popsocket  holder on it as well that I use . I have used this for about a month in the blazing  Florida heat. I am happy with product sofar  only complaint the stickiness of the pad is starting to pull up from dash however not a big deal to change. I would definitely buy again and happy with purchase. The customer service for these products are great as well.

I like it well enough. I'd say it almost has too much suction on the cup, it's really hard to get off once you get it on so just be careful. I like all of the adjustment points and it's pretty sturdy but with all that it's a little more bulky then I would like. It was a bit difficult to find a good mounting point without obstructing my view but overall it is a good product and I'd recommend it.
I have a Kia soul 2014 and the kia soul has a circle in the middle the stand worked perfectly for my car. Great buy.. it wasn't bulky or anything like that.49 people found this helpful

reviewTitle: Doesn't allow room for Pop socket
reviewDescription: Does not work well if you have a pop socket. My phone stays on but it is not on tight because it's literally on the edge of the support on the bottom and the side only clinches a bit of the phone. If we drive over a bump or turn hard, it falls off.

reviewTitle: I wish it stood in place!!
reviewDescription: I love that you can adjust in all directions to maneuver your phone. But I do wish the suction  was better because it just falls off when the car is sitting for a while. So I have to constantly take it off whenever I'm done using it.

I cleaned the surface of the dash and put the adhesive pad down and pressed it down and whatnot and when I came back the next day I put the suction on it and it came right off the dash.Easy fix though as I just suctioned the Mount directly to the dash and haven’t had any problems. The vent mount also works really well

Easy to install. Suction portion has yet to move. The arm is extendable so easier to reach if installed farther away, however at least for my phone with Otterbox in place, it doesn't want to always hold the phone up, almost as if it is too heavy for it. Regardless, was very pleased with it on our 16 hr drive across country! Would purchase again!

reviewTitle: Liked product, sketchy company read description
reviewDescription: Super easy to use, durable and Roomy for those larger phones.Update: still love the holder, however I found d the sketchy FB messages disturbing.  The company offered to let me try 1 of 2 products for free. I chose one and then they wanted me to pay for it through Amazon and screenshot it to know how much money to send me back... too sketchy.  The should be able to send product free on their own or through a discount code.

reviewTitle: Works best on smooth flat surfaces like glass
reviewDescription: Good product... if you attach it to a window or similarly smooth flat surface it sticks real good... dashboard... not so good.  It will slowly peel off and drop with the weight of the cellphone.  It does come with a stick on plate that you basically glue to your dashboard as a mounting point.  It still wants to pull loose but if you put something under the arm to relieve the cellphone weight it works fine.
Good phone mount. Excellent fit. Will purchase again.  The extension makes it all the better

Better alternative to the cellphone holder that clips to your car's air vent so it doesn't block the air and fall out easily. This mounts to the dashboard and you could position it the way you want. However without the adhesive on the suction piece, it will not stay in place. I wonder if it'll ruin or leave goo on the dashboard when removed.  I gave it a 4 stars only because of this. Otherwise, it's pretty sturdy and serves its purpose.

reviewTitle: Dont use it in places that have curves (the black base)
reviewDescription: The product is almost  perfect feels like you got quality holding your phone but I got a sock pocket in my phone like many people and it almost falls out to the front if its too thick so maybe you guys could enlarge the arms of the holder but other than that it’s perfect and i would buy it for all my cars if I had more it also look really futuristic

Had this for about a week now?  Thus far, it's only fallen off once, but I think that has more to do with where I placed it in my vehicle rather than the adhesive.  I was worried about that since it's crazy hot right now, but it hasn't been an issue since.  Otherwise, I'm diggin' it.  Not a bad mount at all.
The adhesive for the mount pad could be stronger. However, I made a formal complaint to the seller and they sent another product without hesitantion

so far so good i have only two complaints. the release button could be in a better place and open the holder fully in stead of taking three pushes becous one and to pushes doesnt open it enough to remove phone and being in a awkward place just makes that it is in a awkward place more annoying

I had been looking at various mounts for my iPhone XR for a long time.  I finally settled on this mount, and I can say that I am very pleased with the results.  The mount is very well made, and is very solid.  The suction cup is very strong.I initially tried this as a window mounted configuration, and when I tried to remove the suction cup, it took me several tries to actually get it off.  The cup does have a sticky substance on it that helps hold the mount in place for longer amounts of time.  Just beware that the sticky solution can wear off if you move it around a lot.  I ended up going with a dashboard mounted configuration, as the unit comes with a flat pad so that the suction cup can be mounted on the dashboard in case it's a bumpy surface, like most dashboards.The mount is easy to manipulate if you want to change from portrait to landscape for map/gps applications.  Just make sure not to tighten the ball mount on the back too tightly, or it will be hard to move.  The mount is also well padded at points where it contacts the phone, and the holders on the mount extend to a very wide with for larger phones.  It holds my iPhone XR, with my OtterBox Symmetry case, very securely with plenty of room to spare for larger phone models.I like that the mount has a release button on the side to expand the mount clamps when you want to remove your phone.  The button can be hard to find, depending on where you have the mount, so be sure to leave some room to push the button so you can easily remove your phone when needed.All in all, a great product for the price.  I would not hesitate to suggest this mount as a great option for your vehicle.

PROS:1.  Several adjustable options make it fit for every phone and almost every desired position.  It has adjustments on the arm that make the arm move forward and back which is good for the distance you want from your window/dash to your hand.  It has a bendable up and down option so you can move it up towards the window or lower.  It has a rotating end so you can turn your phone in a variety of directions.2.  It gives you several parts so you have the option to stick on your windshield, stick to the dash or put in the vent.3.  I love, love, love the adjustable side arms so that you can adjust it to the size of your phone and make it lose enough so you can just drop your phone in and pull it out without two hands.  THis was the number one reason I bought this model.  It also has rubber on the inside to keep your phone in place.4.  The suction really sticks to the window.CONS:1.  If you are going to use the sticky pad for your windshield you better make sure you put it exactly where you want because taking that sucka off is almost impossible.  The little tab they give you to pull it off is so small it's almost impossible to pull and grab.  I wanted to move mine but I can't get it off.  I'll most likely have to use a knife to create a pocket of air to pull it off.2.  Don't place it too high on your windshield because though it has a rotating end, I found the rotation is limited.  Also be careful not to place it too high where it will hit your mirror.  Remember your phone is higher than the unit empty.SUMMARY:  This is worth the buy.  It's easy to put together and comes with many options.  I bought two and recommended it to my parents.

Overall this is a great product. The suction cup works like a suction cup. I recommend using the vent clip because after the arm fell off I decided that the clip stays on and does everything I need. The ball joint on the back of the stand gives it good motion but the screw holds it in place when needed. This product works well and does what it’s made to do extremely well. I highly recommend

reviewTitle: VICSEED is my trusted brand for car mounts!
reviewDescription: I like how they include the suction cup mount and the vent clip so you have the option to choose. I’ve tried many different car mounts, but having to buy them and return them was a hassle. I then decided to try VICSEED’s dash mount. Super easy to use and navigate. I love having my phone vertically up and down, but sometimes I need it horizontally so I can use the navigation system.As I tighten down the screws to adjust the car mount, I noticed how sturdy it was and it didn’t feel like it was going to break as I was tightening it. I’m not sure if you’ve had other car mounts, but when I tighten those, I strip the screws and it no longer holds the level that I need it to. With VICSEED it is super tight and holds my phone well.One-handed operation is something I also look for. I need something that doesn’t take much time and requires me to use both of my hands just to put my phone on a mount. If I can use one hand, it’s a 10/10 for me. I’m always on the go and I require that my phone stays securely on the car mount. If my phone were to fall on the floor, it would be super dangerous for me to look down and find my phone on the floor.It sticks so well to the dashboard and the suction cup is powerful. I cleaned my dashboard with a cleanser and made sure there was no dust sticking onto the suction cup (that’s the number 1 reason why suction cups fail). They also included a 3M adhesive pad which I could’ve used if my dashboard had a textured dashboard. I also have the option to put the car mount onto my windshield if I wanted to but decided not to.Overall, this car mount is something I would buy again if I were to get a new car. I would 100% recommend this to anyone who wants an easy-to-use car mount! The customer service is super friendly and they will literally answer any questions you have. If you need help finding a mount, they’ll help you right away! I love this brand and the products they make! You won’t regret it!

This is perfect. I have a SAAB 9 7x that has square rotating air vents so I really needed more of a dashboard suction kind of phone stand. The problem I often have is the dash is textured and does not hold onto the suction stands for too long. However, this phone stand uses a special kind of system that has a base with glue (that is only usable once, so place well) but cures for 24 hours. After the base is set then the suction part cleanly sucks up the to base, leaving you with an amazing phone stand that will not budge under any rough terrane.The phone holder itself, I guess you could call it 'basket', fully adjusts to your phone using a gear system. The phone cannot fall out due to the friction and slight pressure the stand uses on the phone. In order to release your phone, you just press a small black button on the side, where the gears retract outward and release your phone. On the bottom of that stand, there is a little lip that holds your phone up a bit, it is split into two parts to allow you to charge your phone while it is on the stand.My husband uses the air vent component (both parts are included when purchasing and remember I got two). The air vent component fits perfectly in the Honai Sonata's vent and even has a special piece in the back that laches itself on behind the plastic panel. So when he takes his phone, the entire holder doesn't come out of the vent with it.Honestly, this was a genius design. The manufacturers and designers worked well with each other and really made a solid phone holder. everything works so well together. When you pull it out of the fancy little box you will be amazed at all the little extra steps they took to create the perfect stand, that you can custom place in your car.
