The suction works well on the phone holder but it comes with a disc to stick on your dash board to then put the suction part on. It’s said to wipe the area and then press it on hard for a minute. Then let it sit for up to 72 hours before you try to attach the phone holder. I did all of this and the disc came right up after I attached the phone holder. At least the suction cup works so I can stick  to my window, otherwise I’d return the product.

InStalled on a smooth vertical surface on my truck after cleaning the spot extra well with alcohol. The Adhesive pad fell off after a month of so. Ordered a set of replacement pads and both of them feel off after about a week. I used one of the pads that fell off and attached it with screws: after a day the suction cup gave out and fell off! Now the suction cup wont stick any more. Now i have a adhesive pad screwed to the surface of the truck and the phone holder wont stick to it any longer. Not a good product!

Stuck it on my windshield first, didn’t work.Stuck it on my front dash with the piece given for that afterwards, didn’t work.Was easy to install but didn’t last with me so now I’m out looking for another.

Easy to install as windshield  mounted phone holder. It served its purpose well but after 8 months the phone mount suddenly collapsed. I was surprised to find that the plastic nut that holds the phone mount to the arm had cracked.  I attempted to connect with the manufacturer for a replacement part at the website that the Amazon rep identified for me but keep getting a 404 error message. I will try to see if I can get a replacement for the part at the hardware store but the inability to contact the manufacturer is disappointing.

It's like any other car mount. I don't know why it's advertised as a thick case holder, bc is clearly not. All I have is a popsocket and it is not deep enough to hold the phone. If they would have just made the arms that clamp down just a bit wider, then they could claim that. I really don't know why it's so hard to design a car mount with deep clamp arms that can hold a phone in a case and has a hole on it like most phones now have. Very frustrating. Poor design on all car mount products.

I used the adhesion pad to put up this holder. It lasted about 2 weeks then it wouldn’t stick anymore. I needed the sticky pad because I had many display areas I didn’t want covered by the holder. I also didn’t want to cover an air vent because I live in the south and it gets hot in a car. Unless you are st king the holder on a vent or a completely smooth surface don’t bother with this holder. Waste of my money and my search continues for a phone holder.

reviewTitle: It does not stay in place…..  and the rotation piece broke the first time I used it.
reviewDescription: It does not deliver what it promised.  Cheap material also….. breaks very easy

The suction cup is no joke, it won’t budge, but the platform adheres to your dashboard with a 3M adhesive, and that fell off within two days for me. Otherwise the product is really sturdy, I’m overall happy with it.

This is a really cool product, and held my phone well.  But the package directions said it might not work in very hot climates.  I wish I knew that before  I bought it and it fell off my dash on the freeway (Arizona).  I returned it.

I had this on the car for a 2 weeks before it lost its adhesion and fell off. I had high hopes for this but it did not meet my expectations. I did follow the directions and cleaned and dried the dash area before installing. It did last longer than others, so there is that!
The vent clip comes loose and I have to retighten it at least once per week. It works fine otherwise.
I bought this for my dad and he loved it just the suction only worked on the window and not the dashboard. But that was our only problem everything else was amazing.
it fell after having it on the car for about three weeks so I'm not sure what caused it to fall. maybe the phone was to low and added more weight.

It’s alright , the clip is steady and good the main thing I can’t get it to stick anywhere in my dashboard. I even tried to sandpaper an area make it a bit rough it couldn’t stick regardless might buy gorilla glue to reinforce. Overall the clip is steady and good love it

Every time I use this phone holder it overheats my phone. At first, I thought it was the case but it does the same thing when I take the case off so I'm returning it. It's messed up because it's actually a pretty good phone holder.

I have an otterbox case and a popsocket and my phone still stays in place. Very grippy, can charge phone while in this holder.My fiance bought the low profile magnetic car phone holder- but when he hits a big bimp- the phone falls off.Update: the silicon suction cup turns to goo after two years.
